DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate whether application continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) extubation patient undergoing cardiac surgery reduce hypoxemia re-intubation rate .
DOC.brief_title: CPAP Reduces Hypoxemia After Cardiac Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: We want test hypothesis application continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) extubation patient undergoing cardiac surgery reduce hypoxemia re-intubation rate . Primary end point : reduce rate re-intubation . Secondary end point : reduce incidence atelectasis , pneumonia , sepsis , mortality rate , intensive care unit ( ICU ) hospital length stay .
DOC.criteria: patient undergo cardiac surgery cardiopulmonary bypass PaO2 /FiO2 < 200 extubation extubation time < 24 h. patient < 18 year old extracorporeal membrane oxygenation severe cardiac dysfunction ( FE < 25 % ) mechanical ventilation intervention severe COPD ( patient oxygen therapy , FEV1 < 50 % ) heart lung transplantation lack consent .
